page.title: 06Podington Airfield
page.content: Podington airfield was a wartime air base that was last used by the Ministry of Defence in 1958. Following it's derequisition a few of it's buildings and concrete aprons were removed. Other buildings were retained and used by the Ministry of Supply until about 1968, then some of the land reverted to it's original agricultural use. A Drag Racing Strip was permitted in 1969. The airfield has always posed a problem for the planning authorities. Many of the buildings are in a bad state of repair. Some of the buildings have established use rights for storage and some are occupied by unauthorised industrial users, on who it has been difficult to enforce planning controls with any degree of success. It has always been the policy , to return the land to agriculture.
